intro: Ornithopus albus, commonly known as white broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. Ornithopus albus is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
